text_entry: To Persia, and want guilders for my voyage:

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: Therefore make present satisfaction,

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: Or I'll attach you by this officer.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Even just the sum that I do owe to you

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Is growing to me by Antipholus,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And in the instant that I met with you

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: He had of me a chain: at five o'clock

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I shall receive the money for the same.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Pleaseth you walk with me down to his house,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I will discharge my bond and thank you too.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus and DROMIO of Ephesus from the courtezan's

speaker: Officer
text_entry: That labour may you save: see where he comes.

speaker: Officer
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: While I go to the goldsmith's house, go thou

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And buy a rope's end: that will I bestow

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Among my wife and her confederates,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: For locking me out of my doors by day.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: But, soft! I see the goldsmith. Get thee gone;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Buy thou a rope and bring it home to me.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I buy a thousand pound a year: I buy a rope.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: A man is well holp up that trusts to you:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I promised your presence and the chain;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: But neither chain nor goldsmith came to me.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Belike you thought our love would last too long,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: If it were chain'd together, and therefore came not.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Saving your merry humour, here's the note

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: How much your chain weighs to the utmost carat,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: The fineness of the gold and chargeful fashion.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Which doth amount to three odd ducats more

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Than I stand debted to this gentleman:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I pray you, see him presently discharged,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: For he is bound to sea and stays but for it.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I am not furnish'd with the present money;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Besides, I have some business in the town.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Good signior, take the stranger to my house

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And with you take the chain and bid my wife

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Disburse the sum on the receipt thereof:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Perchance I will be there as soon as you.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Then you will bring the chain to her yourself?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: No; bear it with you, lest I come not time enough.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Well, sir, I will. Have you the chain about you?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: An if I have not, sir, I hope you have;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Or else you may return without your money.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Nay, come, I pray you, sir, give me the chain:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Both wind and tide stays for this gentleman,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And I, to blame, have held him here too long.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Good Lord! you use this dalliance to excuse

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Your breach of promise to the Porpentine.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I should have chid you for not bringing it,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: But, like a shrew, you first begin to brawl.

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: The hour steals on; I pray you, sir, dispatch.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: You hear how he importunes me;--the chain!

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Why, give it to my wife and fetch your money.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Come, come, you know I gave it you even now.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Either send the chain or send me by some token.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Fie, now you run this humour out of breath,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: where's the chain? I pray you, let me see it.

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: My business cannot brook this dalliance.

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: Good sir, say whether you'll answer me or no:

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: If not, I'll leave him to the officer.

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I answer you! what should I answer you?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: The money that you owe me for the chain.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I owe you none till I receive the chain.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: You know I gave it you half an hour since.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: You gave me none: you wrong me much to say so.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: You wrong me more, sir, in denying it:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Consider how it stands upon my credit.

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: Well, officer, arrest him at my suit.

speaker: Officer
text_entry: I do; and charge you in the duke's name to obey me.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: This touches me in reputation.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Either consent to pay this sum for me

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Or I attach you by this officer.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Consent to pay thee that I never had!

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Arrest me, foolish fellow, if thou darest.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Here is thy fee; arrest him, officer,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I would not spare my brother in this case,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: If he should scorn me so apparently.

speaker: Officer
text_entry: I do arrest you, sir: you hear the suit.

speaker: Officer
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I do obey thee till I give thee bail.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: But, sirrah, you shall buy this sport as dear

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: As all the metal in your shop will answer.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Sir, sir, I will have law in Ephesus,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: To your notorious shame; I doubt it not.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Enter DROMIO of Syracuse, from the bay

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Master, there is a bark of Epidamnum

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: That stays but till her owner comes aboard,

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: And then, sir, she bears away. Our fraughtage, sir,

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: I have convey'd aboard; and I have bought

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: The oil, the balsamum and aqua-vitae.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: The ship is in her trim; the merry wind

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Blows fair from land: they stay for nought at all

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: But for their owner, master, and yourself.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: How now! a madman! Why, thou peevish sheep,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: What ship of Epidamnum stays for me?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: A ship you sent me to, to hire waftage.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Thou drunken slave, I sent thee for a rope;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And told thee to what purpose and what end.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: You sent me for a rope's end as soon:

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: You sent me to the bay, sir, for a bark.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I will debate this matter at more leisure

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And teach your ears to list me with more heed.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: To Adriana, villain, hie thee straight:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Give her this key, and tell her, in the desk

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: That's cover'd o'er with Turkish tapestry,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: There is a purse of ducats; let her send it:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Tell her I am arrested in the street

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And that shall bail me; hie thee, slave, be gone!

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: On, officer, to prison till it come.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Exeunt Second Merchant, Angelo, Officer, and Antipholus of Ephesus

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: To Adriana! that is where we dined,

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Where Dowsabel did claim me for her husband:

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: She is too big, I hope, for me to compass.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Thither I must, although against my will,

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: For servants must their masters' minds fulfil.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Exit

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: SCENE II. The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Enter ADRIANA and LUCIANA

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Ah, Luciana, did he tempt thee so?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Mightst thou perceive austerely in his eye

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: That he did plead in earnest? yea or no?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Look'd he or red or pale, or sad or merrily?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: What observation madest thou in this case

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Of his heart's meteors tilting in his face?

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: First he denied you had in him no right.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: He meant he did me none; the more my spite.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Then swore he that he was a stranger here.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And true he swore, though yet forsworn he were.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Then pleaded I for you.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And what said he?

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: That love I begg'd for you he begg'd of me.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: With what persuasion did he tempt thy love?

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: With words that in an honest suit might move.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: First he did praise my beauty, then my speech.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Didst speak him fair?

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Have patience, I beseech.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: I cannot, nor I will not, hold me still;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: My tongue, though not my heart, shall have his will.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: He is deformed, crooked, old and sere,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Ill-faced, worse bodied, shapeless everywhere;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Vicious, ungentle, foolish, blunt, unkind;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Stigmatical in making, worse in mind.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Who would be jealous then of such a one?

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: No evil lost is wail'd when it is gone.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Ah, but I think him better than I say,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And yet would herein others' eyes were worse.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Far from her nest the lapwing cries away:

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: My heart prays for him, though my tongue do curse.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Enter DROMIO of Syracuse

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Here! go; the desk, the purse! sweet, now, make haste.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: How hast thou lost thy breath?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: By running fast.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Where is thy master, Dromio? is he well?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: No, he's in Tartar limbo, worse than hell.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: A devil in an everlasting garment hath him;

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: One whose hard heart is button'd up with steel;

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: A fiend, a fury, pitiless and rough;

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: A wolf, nay, worse, a fellow all in buff;

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: A back-friend, a shoulder-clapper, one that

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: countermands

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: The passages of alleys, creeks and narrow lands;

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: A hound that runs counter and yet draws dryfoot well;

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: One that before the judgement carries poor souls to hell.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Why, man, what is the matter?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: I do not know the matter: he is 'rested on the case.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: What, is he arrested? Tell me at whose suit.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: I know not at whose suit he is arrested well;

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: But he's in a suit of buff which 'rested him, that can I tell.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Will you send him, mistress, redemption, the money in his desk?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Go fetch it, sister.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Exit Luciana

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: This I wonder at,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: That he, unknown to me, should be in debt.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Tell me, was he arrested on a band?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Not on a band, but on a stronger thing;

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: A chain, a chain! Do you not hear it ring?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: What, the chain?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: No, no, the bell: 'tis time that I were gone:

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: It was two ere I left him, and now the clock

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: strikes one.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: The hours come back! that did I never hear.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: O, yes; if any hour meet a sergeant, a' turns back for

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: very fear.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: As if Time were in debt! how fondly dost thou reason!

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Time is a very bankrupt, and owes more than he's

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: worth, to season.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Nay, he's a thief too: have you not heard men say

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: That Time comes stealing on by night and day?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: If Time be in debt and theft, and a sergeant in the way,

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Hath he not reason to turn back an hour in a day?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Re-enter LUCIANA with a purse

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Go, Dromio; there's the money, bear it straight;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And bring thy master home immediately.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Come, sister: I am press'd down with conceit--

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Conceit, my comfort and my injury.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: SCENE III. A public place.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Syracuse

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: There's not a man I meet but doth salute me

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: As if I were their well-acquainted friend;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: And every one doth call me by my name.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Some tender money to me; some invite me;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Some other give me thanks for kindnesses;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Some offer me commodities to buy:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Even now a tailor call'd me in his shop

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: And show'd me silks that he had bought for me,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: And therewithal took measure of my body.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Sure, these are but imaginary wiles

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: And Lapland sorcerers inhabit here.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Enter DROMIO OF SYRACUSE

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Master, here's the gold you sent me for. What, have

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: you got the picture of old Adam new-apparelled?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: What gold is this? what Adam dost thou mean?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Not that Adam that kept the Paradise but that Adam

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: that keeps the prison: he that goes in the calf's

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: skin that was killed for the Prodigal; he that came

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: behind you, sir, like an evil angel, and bid you

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: forsake your liberty.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: I understand thee not.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: No? why, 'tis a plain case: he that went, like a

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: bass-viol, in a case of leather; the man, sir,

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: that, when gentlemen are tired, gives them a sob

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: and 'rests them; he, sir, that takes pity on decayed

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: men and gives them suits of durance; he that sets up

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: his rest to do more exploits with his mace than a

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: morris-pike.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: What, thou meanest an officer?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Ay, sir, the sergeant of the band, he that brings

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: any man to answer it that breaks his band; one that

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: thinks a man always going to bed, and says, 'God

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: give you good rest!'

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Well, sir, there rest in your foolery. Is there any

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Why, sir, I brought you word an hour since that the

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: bark Expedition put forth to-night; and then were

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: you hindered by the sergeant, to tarry for the hoy

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Delay. Here are the angels that you sent for to

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: deliver you.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: The fellow is distract, and so am I;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: And here we wander in illusions:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Some blessed power deliver us from hence!

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Enter a Courtezan

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Well met, well met, Master Antipholus.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: I see, sir, you have found the goldsmith now:

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Is that the chain you promised me to-day?

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Satan, avoid! I charge thee, tempt me not.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Master, is this Mistress Satan?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: It is the devil.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Nay, she is worse, she is the devil's dam; and here

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: she comes in the habit of a light wench: and thereof

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: comes that the wenches say 'God damn me;' that's as

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: much to say 'God make me a light wench.' It is

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: written, they appear to men like angels of light:

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: light is an effect of fire, and fire will burn;

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ergo, light wenches will burn. Come not near her.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Your man and you are marvellous merry, sir.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Will you go with me? We'll mend our dinner here?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Master, if you do, expect spoon-meat; or bespeak a

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: long spoon.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Why, Dromio?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Marry, he must have a long spoon that must eat with

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: the devil.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Avoid then, fiend! what tell'st thou me of supping?

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Thou art, as you are all, a sorceress:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: I conjure thee to leave me and be gone.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Give me the ring of mine you had at dinner,

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Or, for my diamond, the chain you promised,

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: And I'll be gone, sir, and not trouble you.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Some devils ask but the parings of one's nail,

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: A rush, a hair, a drop of blood, a pin,

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: A nut, a cherry-stone;

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: But she, more covetous, would have a chain.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Master, be wise: an if you give it her,

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: The devil will shake her chain and fright us with it.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: I pray you, sir, my ring, or else the chain:

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: I hope you do not mean to cheat me so.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Avaunt, thou witch! Come, Dromio, let us go.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: 'Fly pride,' says the peacock: mistress, that you know.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Exeunt Antipholus of Syracuse and Dromio of Syracuse

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Now, out of doubt Antipholus is mad,

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Else would he never so demean himself.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: A ring he hath of mine worth forty ducats,

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: And for the same he promised me a chain:

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Both one and other he denies me now.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: The reason that I gather he is mad,

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Besides this present instance of his rage,

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Is a mad tale he told to-day at dinner,

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Of his own doors being shut against his entrance.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Belike his wife, acquainted with his fits,

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: On purpose shut the doors against his way.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: My way is now to hie home to his house,

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: And tell his wife that, being lunatic,

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: He rush'd into my house and took perforce

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: My ring away. This course I fittest choose;

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: For forty ducats is too much to lose.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Exit

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: SCENE IV. A street.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus and the Officer

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Fear me not, man; I will not break away:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I'll give thee, ere I leave thee, so much money,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: To warrant thee, as I am 'rested for.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: My wife is in a wayward mood to-day,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And will not lightly trust the messenger

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: That I should be attach'd in Ephesus,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I tell you, 'twill sound harshly in her ears.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Enter DROMIO of Ephesus with a rope's-end

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Here comes my man; I think he brings the money.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: How now, sir! have you that I sent you for?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Here's that, I warrant you, will pay them all.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: But where's the money?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Why, sir, I gave the money for the rope.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Five hundred ducats, villain, for a rope?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I'll serve you, sir, five hundred at the rate.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: To what end did I bid thee hie thee home?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: To a rope's-end, sir; and to that end am I returned.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And to that end, sir, I will welcome you.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Beating him

speaker: Officer
text_entry: Good sir, be patient.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Nay, 'tis for me to be patient; I am in adversity.

speaker: Officer
text_entry: Good, now, hold thy tongue.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Nay, rather persuade him to hold his hands.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Thou whoreson, senseless villain!

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I would I were senseless, sir, that I might not feel

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: your blows.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS
text_entry: Thou art sensible in nothing but blows, and so is an

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS
text_entry: ass.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I am an ass, indeed; you may prove it by my long

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ears. I have served him from the hour of my

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: nativity to this instant, and have nothing at his

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: hands for my service but blows. When I am cold, he

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: heats me with beating; when I am warm, he cools me

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: with beating; I am waked with it when I sleep;

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: raised with it when I sit; driven out of doors with

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: it when I go from home; welcomed home with it when

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I return; nay, I bear it on my shoulders, as a

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: beggar wont her brat; and, I think when he hath

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: lamed me, I shall beg with it from door to door.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Come, go along; my wife is coming yonder.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Enter ADRIANA, LUCIANA, the Courtezan, and PINCH

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Mistress, 'respice finem,' respect your end; or

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: rather, the prophecy like the parrot, 'beware the

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: rope's-end.'

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Wilt thou still talk?

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Beating him

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: How say you now? is not your husband mad?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: His incivility confirms no less.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Good Doctor Pinch, you are a conjurer;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Establish him in his true sense again,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And I will please you what you will demand.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Alas, how fiery and how sharp he looks!

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Mark how he trembles in his ecstasy!

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: Give me your hand and let me feel your pulse.

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: There is my hand, and let it feel your ear.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Striking him

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: I charge thee, Satan, housed within this man,

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: To yield possession to my holy prayers

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: And to thy state of darkness hie thee straight:

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: I conjure thee by all the saints in heaven!

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Peace, doting wizard, peace! I am not mad.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: O, that thou wert not, poor distressed soul!

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: You minion, you, are these your customers?

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Did this companion with the saffron face

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Revel and feast it at my house to-day,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Whilst upon me the guilty doors were shut

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And I denied to enter in my house?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: O husband, God doth know you dined at home;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Where would you had remain'd until this time,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Free from these slanders and this open shame!

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Dined at home! Thou villain, what sayest thou?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Sir, sooth to say, you did not dine at home.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Were not my doors lock'd up and I shut out?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Perdie, your doors were lock'd and you shut out.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And did not she herself revile me there?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Sans fable, she herself reviled you there.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Did not her kitchen-maid rail, taunt, and scorn me?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Certes, she did; the kitchen-vestal scorn'd you.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And did not I in rage depart from thence?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: In verity you did; my bones bear witness,

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: That since have felt the vigour of his rage.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Is't good to soothe him in these contraries?

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: It is no shame: the fellow finds his vein,

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: And yielding to him humours well his frenzy.

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Thou hast suborn'd the goldsmith to arrest me.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Alas, I sent you money to redeem you,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: By Dromio here, who came in haste for it.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Money by me! heart and goodwill you might;

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: But surely master, not a rag of money.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Went'st not thou to her for a purse of ducats?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: He came to me and I deliver'd it.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: And I am witness with her that she did.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: God and the rope-maker bear me witness

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: That I was sent for nothing but a rope!

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: Mistress, both man and master is possess'd;

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: I know it by their pale and deadly looks:

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: They must be bound and laid in some dark room.

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Say, wherefore didst thou lock me forth to-day?

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And why dost thou deny the bag of gold?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: I did not, gentle husband, lock thee forth.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And, gentle master, I received no gold;

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: But I confess, sir, that we were lock'd out.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Dissembling villain, thou speak'st false in both.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Dissembling harlot, thou art false in all;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And art confederate with a damned pack

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: To make a loathsome abject scorn of me:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: But with these nails I'll pluck out these false eyes

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: That would behold in me this shameful sport.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Enter three or four, and offer to bind him. He strives

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: O, bind him, bind him! let him not come near me.

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: More company! The fiend is strong within him.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Ay me, poor man, how pale and wan he looks!

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: What, will you murder me? Thou gaoler, thou,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I am thy prisoner: wilt thou suffer them

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: To make a rescue?

speaker: Officer
text_entry: Masters, let him go

speaker: Officer
text_entry: He is my prisoner, and you shall not have him.

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: Go bind this man, for he is frantic too.

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: They offer to bind Dromio of Ephesus

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: What wilt thou do, thou peevish officer?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Hast thou delight to see a wretched man

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Do outrage and displeasure to himself?

speaker: Officer
text_entry: He is my prisoner: if I let him go,

speaker: Officer
text_entry: The debt he owes will be required of me.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: I will discharge thee ere I go from thee:

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Bear me forthwith unto his creditor,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And, knowing how the debt grows, I will pay it.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Good master doctor, see him safe convey'd

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Home to my house. O most unhappy day!

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: O most unhappy strumpet!

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Master, I am here entered in bond for you.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Out on thee, villain! wherefore dost thou mad me?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Will you be bound for nothing? be mad, good master:

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: cry 'The devil!'

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: God help, poor souls, how idly do they talk!

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Go bear him hence. Sister, go you with me.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Exeunt all but Adriana, Luciana, Officer and Courtezan

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Say now, whose suit is he arrested at?

speaker: Officer
text_entry: One Angelo, a goldsmith: do you know him?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: I know the man. What is the sum he owes?

speaker: Officer
text_entry: Two hundred ducats.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Say, how grows it due?

speaker: Officer
text_entry: Due for a chain your husband had of him.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: He did bespeak a chain for me, but had it not.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: When as your husband all in rage to-day

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Came to my house and took away my ring--

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: The ring I saw upon his finger now--

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Straight after did I meet him with a chain.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: It may be so, but I did never see it.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Come, gaoler, bring me where the goldsmith is:

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: I long to know the truth hereof at large.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Syracuse with his rapier drawn, and DROMIO of Syracuse

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: God, for thy mercy! they are loose again.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And come with naked swords.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Let's call more help to have them bound again.

speaker: Officer
text_entry: Away! they'll kill us.

speaker: Officer
text_entry: Exeunt all but Antipholus of Syracuse and Dromio of Syracuse

speaker: Officer
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: I see these witches are afraid of swords.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: She that would be your wife now ran from you.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Come to the Centaur; fetch our stuff from thence:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: I long that we were safe and sound aboard.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Faith, stay here this night; they will surely do us

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: no harm: you saw they speak us fair, give us gold:

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: methinks they are such a gentle nation that, but for

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: the mountain of mad flesh that claims marriage of

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: me, I could find in my heart to stay here still and

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: turn witch.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: I will not stay to-night for all the town;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Therefore away, to get our stuff aboard.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ACT V

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: SCENE I. A street before a Priory.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Enter Second Merchant and ANGELO

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I am sorry, sir, that I have hinder'd you;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: But, I protest, he had the chain of me,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Though most dishonestly he doth deny it.

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: How is the man esteemed here in the city?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Of very reverend reputation, sir,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Of credit infinite, highly beloved,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Second to none that lives here in the city:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: His word might bear my wealth at any time.

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: Speak softly; yonder, as I think, he walks.

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Syracuse and DROMIO of Syracuse

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: 'Tis so; and that self chain about his neck

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Which he forswore most monstrously to have.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Good sir, draw near to me, I'll speak to him.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Signior Antipholus, I wonder much

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: That you would put me to this shame and trouble;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And, not without some scandal to yourself,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: With circumstance and oaths so to deny

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: This chain which now you wear so openly:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Beside the charge, the shame, imprisonment,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: You have done wrong to this my honest friend,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Who, but for staying on our controversy,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Had hoisted sail and put to sea to-day:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: This chain you had of me; can you deny it?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: I think I had; I never did deny it.

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: Yes, that you did, sir, and forswore it too.

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Who heard me to deny it or forswear it?

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: These ears of mine, thou know'st did hear thee.

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: Fie on thee, wretch! 'tis pity that thou livest

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: To walk where any honest man resort.

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Thou art a villain to impeach me thus:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: I'll prove mine honour and mine honesty

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Against thee presently, if thou darest stand.

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: I dare, and do defy thee for a villain.

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: They draw

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: Enter ADRIANA, LUCIANA, the Courtezan, and others

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Hold, hurt him not, for God's sake! he is mad.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Some get within him, take his sword away:

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Bind Dromio too, and bear them to my house.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Run, master, run; for God's sake, take a house!

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: This is some priory. In, or we are spoil'd!

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Exeunt Antipholus of Syracuse and Dromio of Syracuse to the Priory

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Enter the Lady Abbess, AEMILIA

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Be quiet, people. Wherefore throng you hither?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: To fetch my poor distracted husband hence.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Let us come in, that we may bind him fast

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And bear him home for his recovery.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I knew he was not in his perfect wits.

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: I am sorry now that I did draw on him.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: How long hath this possession held the man?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: This week he hath been heavy, sour, sad,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And much different from the man he was;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: But till this afternoon his passion

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Ne'er brake into extremity of rage.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Hath he not lost much wealth by wreck of sea?

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Buried some dear friend? Hath not else his eye

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Stray'd his affection in unlawful love?

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: A sin prevailing much in youthful men,

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Who give their eyes the liberty of gazing.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Which of these sorrows is he subject to?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: To none of these, except it be the last;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Namely, some love that drew him oft from home.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: You should for that have reprehended him.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Why, so I did.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Ay, but not rough enough.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: As roughly as my modesty would let me.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Haply, in private.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And in assemblies too.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Ay, but not enough.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: It was the copy of our conference:

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: In bed he slept not for my urging it;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: At board he fed not for my urging it;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Alone, it was the subject of my theme;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: In company I often glanced it;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Still did I tell him it was vile and bad.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: And thereof came it that the man was mad.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: The venom clamours of a jealous woman

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Poisons more deadly than a mad dog's tooth.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: It seems his sleeps were hinder'd by thy railing,

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: And therefore comes it that his head is light.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Thou say'st his meat was sauced with thy upbraidings:

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Unquiet meals make ill digestions;

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Thereof the raging fire of fever bred;

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: And what's a fever but a fit of madness?

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Thou say'st his sports were hinderd by thy brawls:

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Sweet recreation barr'd, what doth ensue

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: But moody and dull melancholy,

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Kinsman to grim and comfortless despair,

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: And at her heels a huge infectious troop

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Of pale distemperatures and foes to life?

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: In food, in sport and life-preserving rest

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: To be disturb'd, would mad or man or beast:

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: The consequence is then thy jealous fits

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Have scared thy husband from the use of wits.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: She never reprehended him but mildly,

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: When he demean'd himself rough, rude and wildly.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Why bear you these rebukes and answer not?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: She did betray me to my own reproof.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Good people enter and lay hold on him.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: No, not a creature enters in my house.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Then let your servants bring my husband forth.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Neither: he took this place for sanctuary,

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: And it shall privilege him from your hands

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Till I have brought him to his wits again,

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Or lose my labour in assaying it.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: I will attend my husband, be his nurse,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Diet his sickness, for it is my office,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And will have no attorney but myself;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And therefore let me have him home with me.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Be patient; for I will not let him stir

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Till I have used the approved means I have,

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: With wholesome syrups, drugs and holy prayers,

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: To make of him a formal man again:

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: It is a branch and parcel of mine oath,

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: A charitable duty of my order.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Therefore depart and leave him here with me.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: I will not hence and leave my husband here:

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And ill it doth beseem your holiness

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: To separate the husband and the wife.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Be quiet and depart: thou shalt not have him.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Complain unto the duke of this indignity.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Come, go: I will fall prostrate at his feet

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And never rise until my tears and prayers

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Have won his grace to come in person hither

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And take perforce my husband from the abbess.

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: By this, I think, the dial points at five:

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: Anon, I'm sure, the duke himself in person

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: Comes this way to the melancholy vale,

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: The place of death and sorry execution,

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: Behind the ditches of the abbey here.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Upon what cause?

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: To see a reverend Syracusian merchant,

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: Who put unluckily into this bay

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: Against the laws and statutes of this town,

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: Beheaded publicly for his offence.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: See where they come: we will behold his death.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Kneel to the duke before he pass the abbey.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Enter DUKE SOLINUS, attended; AEGEON bareheaded; with the Headsman and other Officers

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: Yet once again proclaim it publicly,

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: If any friend will pay the sum for him,

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: He shall not die; so much we tender him.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Justice, most sacred duke, against the abbess!

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: She is a virtuous and a reverend lady:

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: It cannot be that she hath done thee wrong.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: May it please your grace, Antipholus, my husband,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Whom I made lord of me and all I had,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: At your important letters,--this ill day

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: A most outrageous fit of madness took him;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: That desperately he hurried through the street,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: With him his bondman, all as mad as he--

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Doing displeasure to the citizens

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: By rushing in their houses, bearing thence

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Rings, jewels, any thing his rage did like.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Once did I get him bound and sent him home,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Whilst to take order for the wrongs I went,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: That here and there his fury had committed.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Anon, I wot not by what strong escape,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: He broke from those that had the guard of him;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And with his mad attendant and himself,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Each one with ireful passion, with drawn swords,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Met us again and madly bent on us,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Chased us away; till, raising of more aid,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: We came again to bind them. Then they fled

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Into this abbey, whither we pursued them:

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And here the abbess shuts the gates on us

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And will not suffer us to fetch him out,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Nor send him forth that we may bear him hence.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Therefore, most gracious duke, with thy command

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Let him be brought forth and borne hence for help.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: Long since thy husband served me in my wars,

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: And I to thee engaged a prince's word,

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: When thou didst make him master of thy bed,

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: To do him all the grace and good I could.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: Go, some of you, knock at the abbey-gate

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: And bid the lady abbess come to me.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: I will determine this before I stir.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: Enter a Servant

speaker: Servant
text_entry: O mistress, mistress, shift and save yourself!

speaker: Servant
text_entry: My master and his man are both broke loose,

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Beaten the maids a-row and bound the doctor

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Whose beard they have singed off with brands of fire;

speaker: Servant
text_entry: And ever, as it blazed, they threw on him

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Great pails of puddled mire to quench the hair:

speaker: Servant
text_entry: My master preaches patience to him and the while

speaker: Servant
text_entry: His man with scissors nicks him like a fool,

speaker: Servant
text_entry: And sure, unless you send some present help,

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Between them they will kill the conjurer.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Peace, fool! thy master and his man are here,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And that is false thou dost report to us.

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Mistress, upon my life, I tell you true;

speaker: Servant
text_entry: I have not breathed almost since I did see it.

speaker: Servant
text_entry: He cries for you, and vows, if he can take you,

speaker: Servant
text_entry: To scorch your face and to disfigure you.

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Cry within

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Hark, hark! I hear him, mistress. fly, be gone!

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: Come, stand by me; fear nothing. Guard with halberds!

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Ay me, it is my husband! Witness you,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: That he is borne about invisible:

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Even now we housed him in the abbey here;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And now he's there, past thought of human reason.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus and DROMIO of Ephesus

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Justice, most gracious duke, O, grant me justice!

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Even for the service that long since I did thee,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: When I bestrid thee in the wars and took

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Deep scars to save thy life; even for the blood

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: That then I lost for thee, now grant me justice.

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: Unless the fear of death doth make me dote,

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: I see my son Antipholus and Dromio.

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Justice, sweet prince, against that woman there!

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: She whom thou gavest to me to be my wife,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: That hath abused and dishonour'd me

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Even in the strength and height of injury!

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Beyond imagination is the wrong

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: That she this day hath shameless thrown on me.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: Discover how, and thou shalt find me just.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: This day, great duke, she shut the doors upon me,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: While she with harlots feasted in my house.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: A grievous fault! Say, woman, didst thou so?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: No, my good lord: myself, he and my sister

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: To-day did dine together. So befall my soul

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: As this is false he burdens me withal!

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Ne'er may I look on day, nor sleep on night,

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: But she tells to your highness simple truth!

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: O perjured woman! They are both forsworn:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: In this the madman justly chargeth them.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: My liege, I am advised what I say,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Neither disturbed with the effect of wine,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Nor heady-rash, provoked with raging ire,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Albeit my wrongs might make one wiser mad.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: This woman lock'd me out this day from dinner:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: That goldsmith there, were he not pack'd with her,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Could witness it, for he was with me then;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Who parted with me to go fetch a chain,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Promising to bring it to the Porpentine,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Where Balthazar and I did dine together.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Our dinner done, and he not coming thither,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I went to seek him: in the street I met him

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And in his company that gentleman.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: There did this perjured goldsmith swear me down

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: That I this day of him received the chain,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Which, God he knows, I saw not: for the which

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: He did arrest me with an officer.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I did obey, and sent my peasant home

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: For certain ducats: he with none return'd

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Then fairly I bespoke the officer

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: To go in person with me to my house.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: By the way we met

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: My wife, her sister, and a rabble more

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Of vile confederates. Along with them

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: They brought one Pinch, a hungry lean-faced villain,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: A mere anatomy, a mountebank,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: A threadbare juggler and a fortune-teller,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: A needy, hollow-eyed, sharp-looking wretch,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: A dead-looking man: this pernicious slave,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Forsooth, took on him as a conjurer,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And, gazing in mine eyes, feeling my pulse,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And with no face, as 'twere, outfacing me,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Cries out, I was possess'd. Then all together

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: They fell upon me, bound me, bore me thence

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And in a dark and dankish vault at home

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: There left me and my man, both bound together;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Till, gnawing with my teeth my bonds in sunder,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I gain'd my freedom, and immediately

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Ran hither to your grace; whom I beseech

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: To give me ample satisfaction

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: For these deep shames and great indignities.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: My lord, in truth, thus far I witness with him,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: That he dined not at home, but was lock'd out.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: But had he such a chain of thee or no?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: He had, my lord: and when he ran in here,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: These people saw the chain about his neck.

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: Besides, I will be sworn these ears of mine

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: Heard you confess you had the chain of him

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: After you first forswore it on the mart:

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: And thereupon I drew my sword on you;

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: And then you fled into this abbey here,

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: From whence, I think, you are come by miracle.

speaker: Second Merchant
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I never came within these abbey-walls,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Nor ever didst thou draw thy sword on me:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I never saw the chain, so help me Heaven!

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And this is false you burden me withal.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: Why, what an intricate impeach is this!

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: I think you all have drunk of Circe's cup.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: If here you housed him, here he would have been;

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: If he were mad, he would not plead so coldly:

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: You say he dined at home; the goldsmith here

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: Denies that saying. Sirrah, what say you?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Sir, he dined with her there, at the Porpentine.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: He did, and from my finger snatch'd that ring.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: 'Tis true, my liege; this ring I had of her.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: Saw'st thou him enter at the abbey here?

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: As sure, my liege, as I do see your grace.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: Why, this is strange. Go call the abbess hither.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: I think you are all mated or stark mad.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: Exit one to Abbess

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: Most mighty duke, vouchsafe me speak a word:

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: Haply I see a friend will save my life

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: And pay the sum that may deliver me.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: Speak freely, Syracusian, what thou wilt.

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: Is not your name, sir, call'd Antipholus?

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: And is not that your bondman, Dromio?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Within this hour I was his bondman sir,

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: But he, I thank him, gnaw'd in two my cords:

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Now am I Dromio and his man unbound.

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: I am sure you both of you remember me.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Ourselves we do remember, sir, by you;

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: For lately we were bound, as you are now

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: You are not Pinch's patient, are you, sir?

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: Why look you strange on me? you know me well.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS
text_entry: I never saw you in my life till now.

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: O, grief hath changed me since you saw me last,

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: And careful hours with time's deformed hand

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: Have written strange defeatures in my face:

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: But tell me yet, dost thou not know my voice?

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Neither.

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: Dromio, nor thou?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: No, trust me, sir, nor I.

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: I am sure thou dost.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Ay, sir, but I am sure I do not; and whatsoever a

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: man denies, you are now bound to believe him.

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: Not know my voice! O time's extremity,

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: Hast thou so crack'd and splitted my poor tongue

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: In seven short years, that here my only son

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: Knows not my feeble key of untuned cares?

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: Though now this grained face of mine be hid

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: In sap-consuming winter's drizzled snow,

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: And all the conduits of my blood froze up,

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: Yet hath my night of life some memory,

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: My wasting lamps some fading glimmer left,

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: My dull deaf ears a little use to hear:

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: All these old witnesses--I cannot err--

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: Tell me thou art my son Antipholus.

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I never saw my father in my life.

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: But seven years since, in Syracusa, boy,

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: Thou know'st we parted: but perhaps, my son,

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: Thou shamest to acknowledge me in misery.

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: The duke and all that know me in the city

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Can witness with me that it is not so

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I ne'er saw Syracusa in my life.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: I tell thee, Syracusian, twenty years

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: Have I been patron to Antipholus,

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: During which time he ne'er saw Syracusa:

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: I see thy age and dangers make thee dote.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: Re-enter AEMILIA, with ANTIPHOLUS of Syracuse and DROMIO of Syracuse

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Most mighty duke, behold a man much wrong'd.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: All gather to see them

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: I see two husbands, or mine eyes deceive me.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: One of these men is Genius to the other;

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: And so of these. Which is the natural man,

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: And which the spirit? who deciphers them?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: I, sir, am Dromio; command him away.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I, sir, am Dromio; pray, let me stay.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: AEgeon art thou not? or else his ghost?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: O, my old master! who hath bound him here?

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Whoever bound him, I will loose his bonds

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: And gain a husband by his liberty.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Speak, old AEgeon, if thou be'st the man

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: That hadst a wife once call'd AEmilia

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: That bore thee at a burden two fair sons:

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: O, if thou be'st the same AEgeon, speak,

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: And speak unto the same AEmilia!

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: If I dream not, thou art AEmilia:

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: If thou art she, tell me where is that son

speaker: AEGEON
text_entry: That floated with thee on the fatal raft?

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: By men of Epidamnum he and I

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: And the twin Dromio all were taken up;

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: But by and by rude fishermen of Corinth

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: By force took Dromio and my son from them

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: And me they left with those of Epidamnum.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: What then became of them I cannot tell

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: I to this fortune that you see me in.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: Why, here begins his morning story right;

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: These two Antipholuses, these two so like,

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: And these two Dromios, one in semblance,--

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: Besides her urging of her wreck at sea,--

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: These are the parents to these children,

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: Which accidentally are met together.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: Antipholus, thou camest from Corinth first?

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: No, sir, not I; I came from Syracuse.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: Stay, stand apart; I know not which is which.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I came from Corinth, my most gracious lord,--

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And I with him.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Brought to this town by that most famous warrior,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Duke Menaphon, your most renowned uncle.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Which of you two did dine with me to-day?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: I, gentle mistress.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And are not you my husband?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: No; I say nay to that.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: And so do I; yet did she call me so:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: And this fair gentlewoman, her sister here,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Did call me brother.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: To Luciana

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: What I told you then,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: I hope I shall have leisure to make good;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: If this be not a dream I see and hear.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: That is the chain, sir, which you had of me.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: I think it be, sir; I deny it not.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And you, sir, for this chain arrested me.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I think I did, sir; I deny it not.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: I sent you money, sir, to be your bail,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: By Dromio; but I think he brought it not.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: No, none by me.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: This purse of ducats I received from you,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: And Dromio, my man, did bring them me.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: I see we still did meet each other's man,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: And I was ta'en for him, and he for me,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: And thereupon these errors are arose.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: These ducats pawn I for my father here.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: It shall not need; thy father hath his life.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Sir, I must have that diamond from you.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: There, take it; and much thanks for my good cheer.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Renowned duke, vouchsafe to take the pains

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: To go with us into the abbey here

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: And hear at large discoursed all our fortunes:

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: And all that are assembled in this place,

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: That by this sympathized one day's error

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Have suffer'd wrong, go keep us company,

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: And we shall make full satisfaction.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Thirty-three years have I but gone in travail

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Of you, my sons; and till this present hour

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: My heavy burden ne'er delivered.

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: The duke, my husband and my children both,

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: And you the calendars of their nativity,

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: Go to a gossips' feast and go with me;

speaker: AEMELIA
text_entry: After so long grief, such festivity!

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: With all my heart, I'll gossip at this feast.

speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
text_entry: Exeunt all but Antipholus of Syracuse, Antipholus of Ephesus, Dromio of Syracuse and Dromio of Ephesus

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Master, shall I fetch your stuff from shipboard?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Dromio, what stuff of mine hast thou embark'd?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Your goods that lay at host, sir, in the Centaur.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: He speaks to me. I am your master, Dromio:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Come, go with us; we'll look to that anon:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Embrace thy brother there; rejoice with him.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Exeunt Antipholus of Syracuse and Antipholus of Ephesus

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: There is a fat friend at your master's house,

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: That kitchen'd me for you to-day at dinner:

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: She now shall be my sister, not my wife.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Methinks you are my glass, and not my brother:

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I see by you I am a sweet-faced youth.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Will you walk in to see their gossiping?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Not I, sir; you are my elder.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: That's a question: how shall we try it?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: We'll draw cuts for the senior: till then lead thou first.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Nay, then, thus:

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: We came into the world like brother and brother;

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And now let's go hand in hand, not one before another.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Exeunt
